Link.Direct.name: Link.Direct
Link.Direct.description:
A port providing message transport between two freedom contexts in the same namespace.
Note that using a direct link does not provide the isolation that freedom.js
encourages. To that end it should be limited to a method for testing and not
used in production without some serious though about the implications of that decision.

link.Frame.name: link.Frame
link.Frame.description: A port providing message transport between two freedom contexts via iFrames.

Worker.name: Worker
Worker.description: A port providing message transport between two freedom contexts via Worker.

API.name: API
API.description:
The API registry for freedom.js.  Used to look up requested APIs,
and provides a bridge for core APIs to act like normal APIs.

util.name: util
util.description: Utility method used within the freedom Library.

Hub.name: Hub
Hub.description:
Defines fdom.Hub, the core message hub between freedom modules.
Incomming messages from apps are sent to hub.onMessage()

Link.name: Link
Link.description:
A link connects two freedom hubs. This is an abstract class
providing common functionality of translating control channels,
and integrating config information.

Policy.name: Policy
Policy.description:
The Policy registry for freedom.js.  Used to look up modules and provide
migration and coallesing of execution.

Manager.name: Manager
Manager.description: A freedom port which manages the control plane of of changing hub routes.

Module.name: Module
Module.description: The external Port face of a module on a hub.

params.name: creator
params.description: The lineage of creation for this module.

ModuleInternal.name: ModuleInternal
ModuleInternal.description:
The internal logic for module setup, which makes sure the public
facing exports have appropriate properties, and load user scripts.

params.name: manager
params.description: The manager in this module to use for routing setup.

Provider.name: Provider
Provider.description: A freedom port for a user-accessable provider.

Proxy.name: Proxy
Proxy.description: A freedom port for a user-accessable proxy.

params.name: interfaceCls
params.description: The proxy interface exposed by this proxy.

Resource.name: Resource
Resource.description:
The Resource registry for FreeDOM.  Used to look up requested Resources,
and provide lookup and migration of resources.

handleEvents.name: handleEvents
handleEvents.description:
Add 'on' and 'emit' methods to an object, which act as a light weight
event handling structure.

classitems.description: Set up an iFrame with an isolated freedom.js context inside.
classitems.name: setupFrame

classitems.description:
Make frames to replicate freedom isolation without web-workers.
iFrame isolation is non-standardized, and access to the DOM within frames
means that they are insecure. However, debugging of webworkers is
painful enough that this mode of execution can be valuable for debugging.
classitems.name: makeFrame

classitems.description:
Recursively traverse a [nested] object and freeze its keys from being
writable. Note, the result can have new keys added to it, but existing ones
cannot be  overwritten. Doesn't do anything for arrays or other collections.

Get an API.

params.description: The JSON object defining the API.

classitems.description: Register a core API provider.

params.name: constructor
params.description: the function to create a provider for the API.

params.name: style
params.description:
The style the provider is written in. Valid styles
  are documented in fdom.port.Provider.prototype.getInterface. Defaults to
  provideAsynchronous

classitems.description: Get a core API connected to a given FreeDOM module.
classitems.name: getCore

return.description:
A promise of a fdom.App look-alike matching
a local API definition.

classitems.description:
Get the style in which a core API is written.
This method is guaranteed to know the style of a provider returned from
a previous getCore call, and so does not use promises.

return.description:
The coding style, as used by
  fdom.port.Provider.prototype.getInterface.

classitems.description: Defines fdom.apis for fdom module registry and core provider registation.

External freedom Setup.  global.freedom is set to the value returned by
setup (see preamble.js and postamble.js for that mechanism).  As a result,
this is the primary entry function for the freedom library.
classitems.name: setup

params.name: global
params.description: The window / frame / worker context freedom is in.

params.description: The textual code of freedom, for replication.

Deregister a destination for messages with the hub.
Note: does not remove associated routes. As such, deregistering will
prevent the installation of new routes, but will not distrupt existing
hub routes.

params.name: flow

return.description: A routing source identifier for sending messages.

classitems.description: A freedom port providing debugging output to the console.
Provide a textual description of this port.
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description:
Handler for receiving messages sent to the debug port.
These messages are used to retreive config for exposing console.
classitems.name: onMessage

params.name: source
params.description: the source identifier for the message.

classitems.description: Dispatch a debug message with arbitrary severity.
classitems.name: format

classitems.description: Print received messages on the console.
classitems.name: print

params.name: message
params.description: The message emitted by {@see format} to print.

classitems.description: Print a log message to the console.
classitems.name: log

classitems.description: Print a warning message to the console.
classitems.name: warn

classitems.description: Print an error message to the console.
classitems.name: error

classitems.description: Provide a textual description of this port.
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description:
Process messages sent to this port.
The manager, or 'control' destination handles several types of messages,
identified by the request property.  The actions are:
1. debug. Prints the message to the console.
2. link. Creates a link between the source and a provided destination port.
3. port. Creates a link between the source and a described port type.
4. delegate. Routes a defined set of control messages to another location.
5. resource. Registers the source as a resource resolver.
6. core. Generates a core provider for the requester.
7. close. Tears down routes involing the requesting port.
8. unlink. Tears down a route from the requesting port.
classitems.name: onMessage

params.name: flow
params.description: The source identifier of the message.

classitems.description: Get the port messages will be routed to given its id.

Create a link between two ports.  Links are created in both directions,
and a message with those capabilities is sent to the source port.

params.name: name
params.description: The flow for messages from destination to port.

params.name: destName
params.description: The flow name for messages to the destination.

params.name: toDest
params.description: Tell the destination rather than source about the link.

classitems.description: Update the module environment with information about a dependent manifest.

classitems.description:
Message handler for this port.
This port only handles two messages:
The first is its setup from the manager, which it uses for configuration.
The second is from the module controller (fdom.port.Module), which provides
the manifest info for the module.

Request a set of proxy interfaces, and bind them to the external
namespace.

params.description: Descriptors of the proxy ports to load.

Create a proxy for a single manifest item, and attach it to the global
context once it is loaded.

props.description: The name of the API for the link.

props.name: provides
props.description: Whether the link is a provider.

classitems.description:
Update the exported manifest of a dependency.
Sets it internally if not yet exported, or attaches the property if it
is loaded after the module has started (we don't delay start to retreive
the manifest of the dependency.)

return.description: proxy descriptors defined in the manifest.

params.description: The URLs of the scripts to load.

classitems.description: Provider modes of operation.

params.name: source
params.description: the source identifier of the message.

classitems.description:
Get an interface to expose externally representing this port.
Providers are registered with the port using either
provideSynchronous or provideAsynchronous depending on the desired
return interface.

return.description: The external interface of this Provider.

Create a function that can be used to get interfaces from this provider from
a user-visible point.

classitems.name: toString

classitems.description: Receive incoming messages for this proxy.
classitems.name: onMessage

classitems.description:
Create a proxy.Interface associated with this proxy.
An interface is returned, which is supplied with important control of the
proxy via constructor arguments: (bound below in getInterfaceConstructor)

onMsg: function(binder) sets the function to call when messages for this
   interface arrive on the channel,
emit: function(msg) allows this interface to emit messages,
id: string is the Identifier for this interface.
classitems.name: getInterface

classitems.description:
Create a function that can be used to get interfaces from this proxy from
a user-visible point.
classitems.name: getProxyInterface

classitems.description:
Provides a bound class for creating a proxy.Interface associated
with this proxy. This partial level of construction can be used
to allow the proxy to be used as a provider for another API.
classitems.name: getInterfaceConstructor

classitems.name: doEmit

params.name: to
params.description: The ID of the flow sending the message.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the interface to tear down.

classitems.name: error

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the interface where the error occured.

params.name: message
params.description: The message which failed, if relevant.

classitems.name: toString

classitems.description: Resolve a resurce URL requested from a module.
classitems.name: get

params.name: manifest
params.description: The canonical address of the module requesting.

return.description: A promise for the resource address.

classitems.description: Get the contents of a resource.
classitems.name: getContents

return.description: A promise for the resource contents.

classitems.description:
Resolve a resource using known resolvers. Unlike get, resolve does
not cache resolved resources.
classitems.name: resolve

return.description: A promise for the resource address.

classitems.description:
Register resolvers: code that knows how to get resources
needed by the runtime. A resolver will be called with four
arguments: the absolute manifest of the requester, the
resource being requested, and a resolve / reject pair to
fulfill a promise.
classitems.name: addResolver

classitems.description:
Register retrievers: code that knows how to load resources
needed by the runtime. A retriever will be called with a URL
to retrieve with a protocol that it is able to handle.
classitems.name: addRetriever

classitems.description: Determine if a URL is an absolute URL of a given Scheme.
classitems.name: hasScheme

return.description: If the URL is an absolute example of one of the schemes.

classitems.description:
Remove './' and '../' from a URL
Required because Chrome Apps for Mobile (cca) doesn't understand
XHR paths with these relative components in the URL.
classitems.name: removeRelativePath

classitems.description: Resolve URLs which can be accessed using standard HTTP requests.
classitems.name: httpResolver

return.description: True if the URL could be resolved.

classitems.description: Resolve URLs which are self-describing.
classitems.name: nullResolver

return.description: True if the URL could be resolved.

classitems.description:
Retrieve manifest content from a self-descriptive manifest url.
These urls are used to reference a manifest without requiring subsequent,
potentially non-CORS requests.
classitems.name: manifestRetriever

classitems.description: Retrieve resource contents using an XHR request.
classitems.name: xhrRetriever

classitems.description: Defines fdom.resources as a singleton registry for file management.

Helper function for iterating over an array backwards. If the func
returns a true value, it will break out of the loop.
classitems.name: eachReverse

classitems.description:
Cycles over properties in an object and calls a function for each
property value. If the function returns a truthy value, then the
iteration is stopped.
classitems.name: eachProp

classitems.description:
Simple function to mix in properties from source into target,
but only if target does not already have a property of the same name.
This is not robust in IE for transferring methods that match
Object.prototype names, but the uses of mixin here seem unlikely to
trigger a problem related to that.
classitems.name: mixin

classitems.description: Get a unique ID.
classitems.name: getId

classitems.description:
Filter a list based on a predicate. The list is filtered in place, with

params.description: The method to run on each item.

When run without a window, or specifically requested.
